fglcdvMedia

Genero BDL wrapper around the Cordova Media plugin.

Variables

playOptions

DEFINE playOptions playOptionsT

Helper to avoid the need to define this record in user code if there is just one player

Functions

create

FUNCTION create(soundId STRING, filename STRING)

Registers a media source for a sound identifier to be used in subsequent calls.

For most applications, it's sufficient to register exactly one soundId. Multiple soundIds are needed only if several audio sources need to be played simultaneously.

One and the same soundId can be used for recording and playing if recording and playing is done exclusively.

Parameters:
soundId - the identifier to be associated to the media source
filename - file path for playing or recording, or URL for streaming.

getCurrentAmplitudeAudio

FUNCTION getCurrentAmplitudeAudio(soundId STRING) RETURNS FLOAT

Returns the Audio Meter level when recording.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the recording.
Returns:
a normalized value between 0.0 and 1.0 .

getCurrentPositionAudio

FUNCTION getCurrentPositionAudio(soundId STRING) RETURNS FLOAT

Returns the playback elasped time.

The returned value is a FLOAT representing a number of seconds, with sub-seconds after the decimal point.

Only works while playing a sound file, not while recording.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the playback.
Returns:
the elapsed time.

getDurationAudio

FUNCTION getDurationAudio(soundId STRING) RETURNS FLOAT

Returns the duration for a media id.

This works only if the file exists and is playable.

The returned value is a FLOAT representing a number of seconds, with sub-seconds after the decimal point.

Parameters:
soundId - is the sound identifier registered with a create() call
Returns:
duration of the file.

getDurationFromStatus

FUNCTION getDurationFromStatus(mediaStatus StatusT) RETURNS FLOAT

Returns the media duration when the status message type is MEDIA_DURATION.

The returned value is a FLOAT representing a number of seconds, with sub-seconds after the decimal point.

Parameters:
mediaStatus - is the return value of getNextStatus()
Returns:
returns a duration out of the given mediaStatus.

getErrorFromStatus

FUNCTION getErrorFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNS INTEGER, STRING

Returns the error code and error message when the status message type is MEDIA_ERROR.

Parameters:
mediaStatus - pass the return value of getNextStatus()
Returns:
an error code and an error message.

getMediaIdFromStatus

FUNCTION getMediaIdFromStatus(mediaStatus StatusT) RETURNS STRING

Returns the media identifier causing the status event.

Parameters:
mediaStatus - is the return value of getNextStatus()
Returns:
a mediaId used for recording of playing.

getMessageTypeFromStatus

FUNCTION getMessageTypeFromStatus(mediaStatus StatusT) RETURNS INTEGER

Returns a message type from the given StatusT.

Parameters:
mediaStatus - is the return value of getNextStatus()
Returns:
MEDIA_STATE, MEDIA_DURATION, MEDIA_POSITION or MEDIA_ERROR

getNextStatus

FUNCTION getNextStatus() RETURNS StatusT

Returns the next queued status object.

The status object is removed from the internal queue. The status object can be treated as a kind of opaque handle, you should never access it directly. This status object can then be passed to the xxFromStatus functions.

 WHILE (mediaStatus:=getNextStatus()) IS NOT NULL
   LET messageType=fglcdvMedia.getMessageTypeFromStatus(mediaStatus)
   LET mediaId=fglcdvMedia.getMediaIdFromStatus(mediaStatus)
   CASE messageType
     WHEN fglcdvMedia.MEDIA_STATE
       LET state=fglcdvMedia.getStateFromStatus(mediaStatus)
     WHEN fglcdvMedia.MEDIA_DURATION
       LET duration=fglcdvMedia.getDurationFromStatus(mediaStatus)
     WHEN fglcdvMedia.MEDIA_POSITION
       LET position=fglcdvMedia.getPositionFromStatus(mediaStatus)
     WHEN fglcdvMedia.MEDIA_ERROR
       CALL fglcdvMedia.getErrorFromStatus(mediaStatus) RETURNING code,message
 END WHILE

Returns:
a StatusT object.

getPositionFromStatus

FUNCTION getPositionFromStatus(mediaStatus StatusT) RETURNS FLOAT

Returns the media position when the status message type is MEDIA_POSITION.

The returned value is a FLOAT representing a number of seconds, with sub-seconds after the decimal point.

Parameters:
mediaStatus - is the return value of getNextStatus()
Returns:
returns a media position out of the given mediaStatus.

getRecordingExtensions

FUNCTION getRecordingExtensions() RETURNS DYNAMIC ARRAY OF STRING

Returns an array containing valid file extensions for recording.

Returns:
The list of recording file extensions (m4a for ex)

getStateFromStatus

FUNCTION getStateFromStatus(mediaStatus StatusT) RETURNS INTEGER

Returns the media state when the status message type is MEDIA_STATE.

Parameters:
mediaStatus - is the return value of getNextStatus()
Returns:
MEDIA_STATE_NONE, MEDIA_STATE_STARTING, MEDIA_STATE_RUNNING, MEDIA_STATE_PAUSED, MEDIA_STATE_STOPPED

getStatusCount

FUNCTION getStatusCount() RETURNS INTEGER

Returns the number of status objects that have been queued.

Returns:
count of objects

handleCallback

FUNCTION handleCallback()

Handles media events for the cordovacallback action.

Handles all media events in response to a cordovacallback action and queues media status messages internally. Those status messages can then be fetched with getNextStatus().

 ON ACTION cordovacallback
   CALL fglcdvMedia.handleCallback()
   WHILE (mediastatus:=fglcdv.getNextStatus()) IS NOT NULL
     --do things with the status objects

init

FUNCTION init()

Initializes the plugin must be called prior other calls

isValidRecordingExtension

FUNCTION isValidRecordingExtension(extension STRING) RETURNS BOOLEAN

Returns TRUE if a given file extension is a valid extension for recording.

Parameters:
extension - extension such as "m4a" or "aac"
Returns:
TRUE if the extension is usable for recording, FALSE otherwise

mediaState2String

FUNCTION mediaState2String(state INTEGER) RETURNS STRING

Returns a string description for a media state.

Parameters:
state - can be one of: MEDIA_STATE_NONE, MEDIA_STATE_STARTING, MEDIA_STATE_RUNNING,MEDIA_STATE_PAUSED, MEDIA_STATE_STOPPED
Returns:
"None", "Starting", "Running", "Paused", Or "Stopped"

messageType2String

FUNCTION messageType2String(messageType INTEGER) RETURNS STRING

Returns a string description for a messageType

Parameters:
messageType - can be one of MEDIA_STATE, MEDIA_DURATION,MEDIA_POSITION,MEDIA_ERROR
Returns:
"MEDIA_STATE", "MEDIA_DURATION", "MEDIA_POSITION", Or "MEDIA_ERROR"

pausePlayingAudio

FUNCTION pausePlayingAudio(soundId STRING)

Pauses audio playing.

Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Resume playing with startPlayingAudio().

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the playback.

pauseRecordingAudio

FUNCTION pauseRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)

Pauses audio recording.

Resume recording with resumeRecordingAudio().

Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the recording.

release

FUNCTION release(soundId STRING)

Releases resources associated with a sound identifier.

Resources are for example the file name, players and internal recording buffers.

Parameters:
soundId - is the sound identifier to be released.

resumeRecordingAudio

FUNCTION resumeRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)

Resumes audio recording.

Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the recording.

seekToAudio

FUNCTION seekToAudio(soundId STRING, position INTEGER)

Seek a position in the audio stream.

Only available for playback.

May cause a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the playback.
position - milliseconds since start.

setRate

FUNCTION setRate(soundId STRING, rate FLOAT)

Sets the playback rate: only available in IOS.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the playback.
rate - range 0.0 to 1.0 .

setVolume

FUNCTION setVolume(soundId STRING, volume FLOAT)

Sets the audio volume.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the playback.
volume - range 0.0 to 1.0 .

startPlayingAudio

FUNCTION startPlayingAudio(soundId STRING, playOptions playOptionsT)

Starts playing a sound file.

When the playback is over, a cordovacallback action is triggered.

The file for playback must have been registered with the create call, and must exist. The file extension can vary depending on the platform.

Parameters:
soundId - is the sound identifier registered with a create() call
playOptions - see playOptionsT

startRecordingAudio

FUNCTION startRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)

Starts recording to file.

If the file exists, it will be overwritten. The directory for the file must exist.

Possible recording file extensions on IOS: .wav and .mp4 , on Android: .mp3 and .aac .

Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - is the sound identifier registered with a create() call

stopPlayingAudio

FUNCTION stopPlayingAudio(soundId STRING)

Stops audio playing.

Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the playback.

stopRecordingAudio

FUNCTION stopRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)

Stops audio recording.

Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the recording.
